txt.en:
'Ho there... are ye that Stone-eater Rhus Cornchúthur befriended? I can't say I approve... what should we have to do with duvodiad? Well, while you're here, I suppose I could make use of ye.

'I'm an artist, you see, and need materials for my work. I make art from the antlers of the white stags. Unfortunately, I usually have to settle with ivory that our hunters collect from stags which the Rhi Helvarch has slain... they are too afraid to hunt the stags themselves.

'If ye could hunt some of the white stags and bring me their antlers... well, ye might make more of an impression on me.'

'Ho there... are ye that spirit Rhus Cornchúthur befriended? I can't say I approve... what should we have to do with duvodiad? Well, while you're here, I suppose I could make use of ye.

'I'm an artist, you see, and need materials for my work. I make art from the antlers of the white stags. Unfortunately, I usually have to settle with ivory that our hunters collect from stags which the Rhi Helvarch has slain... they are too afraid to hunt the stags themselves.

'If ye could hunt some of the white stags and bring me their antlers... well, ye might make more of an impression on me.'
Making a Point

'Ho there... ye must be that northern cousin what brought us the wondrous smoking weed. I'm very pleased to meet ye. Might ye have a moment to speak with me?

'I'm an artist, you see, and need materials for my work. I make art from the antlers of the white stags. Unfortunately, I usually have to settle with ivory that our hunters collect from stags which the Rhi Helvarch has slain... they are too afraid to hunt the stags themselves.

'If ye could hunt some of the white stags and bring me their antlers... well, I would be mighty grateful.'
'Have ye found such antlers as I need, stone-eater?'
Collected stag-antlers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Have ye found such antlers as I need, giant?'

'Ho there... ye must be the River Hobbit what brought us the wondrous smoking weed. I'm very pleased to meet ye. Might ye have a moment to speak with me?

'I'm an artist, you see, and need materials for my work. I make art from the antlers of the white stags. Unfortunately, I usually have to settle with ivory that our hunters collect from stags which the Rhi Helvarch has slain... they are too afraid to hunt the stags themselves.

'If ye could hunt some of the white stags and bring me their antlers... well, I would be mighty grateful.'
'Have ye found such antlers as I need, spirit?'
'Have ye found such antlers as I need, cousin?'
White stags can be found throughout the Gloomglens in Enedwaith.\n\nRhosun Turio has asked you to collect stag-antlers for her to continue her scrimshaw.
'Oh my! These antlers are most beautiful... they will become more beautiful yet at my hand!\n\n'Thank ye, Duvodiad! You've proven your worthiness to me.'
Rhosun Turio can be found in Maur Tulhau in the Gloomglens of Enedwaith.\n\nYou should bring the stag-antlers you collected back to Rhosun Turio.
'I'll need more antlers to continue my work, Duvodiad!'
Collect stag-antlers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to Rhosun Turio at Maur Tulhau
'Oh my! These antlers are most beautiful... they will become more beautiful yet at my hand!\n\n'Thank ye, Duvodiad! You've proven your worthiness to me.'
'I'll need more antlers to continue my work, Duvodiad!'
'Oh my! These antlers are most beautiful... they will become more beautiful yet at my hand!\n\n'Thank ye, Duvodiad! You've proven your worthiness to me.'
'I'll need more antlers to continue my work, Duvodiad!'
'Oh my! These antlers are most beautiful... they will become more beautiful yet at my hand!\n\n'Thank ye, cousin! You've proven a true friend.'
'I'll need more antlers to continue my work, Duvodiad!'
Rhosun Turio is an artist in Maur Tulhau who works with stag-ivory scrimshaw.

'Ho there... are ye that giant Rhus Cornchúthur befriended? I can't say I approve... what should we have to do with duvodiad? Well, while you're here, I suppose I could make use of ye.

'I'm an artist, you see, and need materials for my work. I make art from the antlers of the white stags. Unfortunately, I usually have to settle with ivory that our hunters collect from stags which the Rhi Helvarch has slain... they are too afraid to hunt the stags themselves.

'If ye could hunt some of the white stags and bring me their antlers... well, ye might make more of an impression on me.'
